For those below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level, there is absolutely no cost sharing. Zero. For individuals and families between 200% and 600% FPL, premiums are established on a sliding scale, but no one will pay more that 9% of their adjusted monthly gross income.

There’s much more to say, but thank you for making it this far. We are hard at work making revisions based on feedback, including from some of the comments we’ve seen on Twitter! We’re proud of our vision for #Med4America, and look forward to sharing the new bill soon.

For primary, mental & behavioral health, the Secretary will increase those reimbursement rates by at least 30%. Why? Individuals on Medicare & Medicaid face tremendous barriers in attaining primary & mental health care. What good is coverage if no doctor in your area takes it?

Since some things are going to be covered for the first time, the Secretary of HHS will be establishing those rates. #Med4America will be negotiating prescription drug prices, and a quick note, #Med4America has all-payer rate setting.

Spoiler alert: there will be no deductible when we reintroduce #Med4America. We will have a maximum out of pocket of $3500/$5000 (on a sliding scale). Things exempt from cost-sharing: preventive/chronic disease services, LTSS, and most prescription drugs.

Beyond adding dental, vision, and hearing, #Med4America includes Long-Term Services and Supports—one the most important benefits we include. No health system is truly universal unless it covers LTSS. Check out Section 2203. #AllMeansAll  https://delauro.house.gov/sites/delauro.house.gov/files/Medicare_for_America_Act_.pdf …

Many have said Medicaid for all would be better because the benefits covered are better than Medicare. That’s why the #Med4America benefits package is based on Connecticut’s HUSKY. An extensive list ensures that every American has the same strong set of benefits.

Right now in the U.S., health coverage is determined by zip code. Medicaid and state mandates vary drastically, and if our goal is universal coverage, we can no longer have a system where states decide what benefits to cover.

#Med4America does allow for employers to provide coverage as long as it is gold level. Far too many employers have become less generous while wages have not increased. Employers can also enroll their employees into #Med4America. Or you as an employee can pick #Med4America

FYI: Medicare for America is not a public option. It auto-enrolls newborns from birth, everyone who is uninsured at any time, those on exchange plans into #Med4America. We transition seniors currently on Medicare/Medicaid/CHIP into #Med4America.

I urge my colleagues to work with us to support a comprehensive solution for working Americans.

No one should have to make the choice between taking care of themselves or their family or missing a paycheck. That is why Congress needs to enact the FAMILY Act, the only plan that provides comprehensive benefits for workers that need to care for themselves and their families.

Workers should not have to permanently cut their Social Security retirement benefits to spend time with a newborn child. Moreover, this bill is silent on the more than three-quarters of working people that need paid medical leave to care for a loved one who falls ill.
The Ernst-Lee paid parental leave proposal announced today is woefully insufficient and would hurt working families by breaking the promise of their hard-earned Social Security.
